context: Article 1: The purpose of this law is to regulate individual and collective labor relations between wage-earning workers and employers.
Article 17: No discrimination based on gender is permitted in matters of employment.
Article 3: An employment contract is an agreement by which a person undertakes to provide services to another person, called the employer, in exchange for remuneration.
Article 46: Female employees are entitled to 14 weeks of maternity leave, covering prenatal and postnatal periods, with full pay.
Article 55: Employers must ensure breastfeeding facilities for female employees as per internal regulations.
Article 141: Violations of working conditions for women may result in sanctions, including fines or imprisonment.
Article 143: Employers failing to comply with maternity leave provisions face penalties under the Labor Code.
Article 5: The legal workweek is set at 40 hours, distributed over at least five working days.
Article 6: Overtime is limited to 20% of legal working hours and must be paid at least 50% above the normal hourly rate.
Article 7: Night work, defined as work between 21:00 and 05:00, is prohibited for workers under 19 years of age.
Article 8: Employees are entitled to a weekly rest day, typically Friday, with compensatory rest if worked.
Article 9: Annual leave is accrued at 2.5 days per month, up to a maximum of 30 calendar days per year.
Article 10: Workers in southern regions are entitled to an additional 10 days of annual leave.
Article 11: Paid absences are granted for union duties, training, and examinations.
Article 12: Employees are entitled to 3 paid days for family events such as marriage, birth, or death of a close relative.
Article 13: Workers are entitled to a one-time paid leave for pilgrimage during their career.
Article 14: Legal holidays, such as 1 May, 5 July, and 1 November, are paid and non-working days.
Article 15: Employees of Christian faith are entitled to paid holidays for Easter Monday, Ascension, 15 August, and 25 December.
Article 16: Employees of Jewish faith are entitled to paid holidays for Rosh Hashanah, Yom Kippur, and Passover.
Article 18: Employers must register employees with social security within 10 days of hiring.
Article 19: Employers must provide a safe working environment, including protective equipment for hazardous tasks.
Article 20: Workplace safety inspections must be conducted regularly by qualified personnel.
Article 21: Employers must maintain records of safety training for at least three years.
Article 22: Workers exposed to eye hazards must be provided with safety goggles.
Article 23: Employers must ensure clean drinking water is available at all workplaces.
Article 24: Noise levels in workplaces must comply with health and safety standards.
Article 25: Employers must conduct risk assessments for industries involving hazardous materials.
Article 26: Workers are entitled to paid sick leave for up to 15 days per year with a medical certificate.
Article 27: Employers must report workplace accidents to the labor inspectorate within 48 hours.
Article 28: Fatal workplace accidents must be reported within 24 hours to the labor inspectorate.
Article 29: Employers must provide ergonomic workstations to prevent occupational injuries.
Article 30: Workers have the right to join trade unions without employer interference.
Article 31: Collective bargaining agreements are binding and must be respected by employers.
Article 32: Employers must provide written notice of termination at least 30 days in advance.
Article 33: Termination without just cause is considered abusive and may result in compensation.
Article 34: Workers dismissed for reporting violations are entitled to reinstatement or compensation.
Article 35: Employers must issue certificates of employment upon termination.
Article 36: Pay slips must detail all salary components, including bonuses and deductions.
Article 37: Salaries are protected from seizure except under specific legal conditions.
Article 38: Employers must provide training to enhance workers' skills and productivity.
Article 39: Workers have the right to participate in workplace decision-making through elected representatives.
Article 40: Employers must ensure non-discrimination based on religion, ethnicity, or union membership.
Article 41: Workers are entitled to social security benefits, including health and retirement coverage.
Article 42: Employers must contribute to social security funds on behalf of employees.
Article 43: Workers have the right to a safe and healthy work environment free from harassment.
Article 44: Employers must establish policies to prevent workplace harassment.
Article 45: Workers are entitled to severance pay in case of redundancy.
Article 46: Employers must maintain attendance records for at least two years.
Article 47: Workers have the right to request flexible work arrangements for family or medical reasons.
Article 48: Employers must provide paid leave for mental health counseling.
Article 49: Workers are entitled to paid leave for adoption of a child.
Article 50: Employers must provide safety harnesses for workers at heights.
Article 51: Workers are entitled to a transportation allowance for work-related travel.
Article 52: Employers must provide respiratory masks for workers exposed to toxic substances.
Article 53: Workers are entitled to paid leave for military service.
Article 54: Employers must provide childcare facilities for employees with young children.
Article 55: Workers are entitled to paid leave for bereavement.
Article 56: Employers must ensure lighting standards comply with occupational health requirements.
Article 57: Workers are entitled to paid leave for religious holidays specific to their faith.
Article 58: Employers must report layoffs to the labor inspectorate within 30 days.
Article 59: Workers have the right to appeal disciplinary sanctions through internal procedures.
Article 60: Employers must provide written contracts in Arabic, specifying salary in Algerian dinars.
Article 61: Workers are entitled to a trial period before permanent employment.
Article 62: Employers must provide paid leave for workers attending court hearings.
Article 63: Workers are entitled to a minimum wage adjusted annually based on economic conditions.
Article 64: Employers must ensure compliance with maximum overtime limits.
Article 65: Workers are entitled to rest periods during shifts exceeding 6 hours.
Article 66: Employers must provide protective clothing for workers in hazardous environments.
Article 67: Workers are entitled to paid leave for compassionate reasons.
Article 68: Employers must ensure compliance with anti-discrimination laws in hiring practices.
Article 69: Workers have the right to request workplace accommodations for disabilities.
Article 70: Employers must provide training on workplace safety annually.
Article 71: Workers are entitled to paid leave for paternity.
Article 72: Employers must ensure compliance with child labor laws prohibiting work for those under 16.
Article 73: Workers are entitled to a notice period of at least 30 days before termination.
Article 74: Employers must provide a policy for workplace diversity training.
Article 75: Workers are entitled to paid leave for attending union meetings.
Article 76: Employers must ensure compliance with laws prohibiting wage deductions without consent.
Article 77: Workers are entitled to legal aid if earning less than twice the SNMG.
Article 78: Employers must provide a hotline for reporting workplace violations anonymously.
Article 79: Workers are entitled to paid leave for attending professional development courses.
Article 80: Employers must ensure compliance with laws prohibiting retaliation for reporting violations.
Article 81: Workers are entitled to a safe work environment free from toxic substances.
Article 82: Employers must provide paid leave for workers participating in national elections.
Article 83: Workers are entitled to a maximum of 12 hours of daily work, including breaks.
Article 84: Employers must ensure compliance with laws prohibiting forced labor.
Article 85: Workers are entitled to paid leave for attending arbitration hearings.
Article 86: Employers must provide a policy for handling workplace grievances.
Article 87: Workers are entitled to a minimum rest period of 30 minutes during an 8-hour shift.
Article 88: Employers must ensure compliance with laws prohibiting child exploitation.
Article 89: Workers are entitled to paid leave for attending safety training sessions.
Article 90: Employers must provide a policy for managing workplace accidents.
Article 91: Workers are entitled to a maximum of 20% overtime hours per week.
Article 92: Employers must ensure compliance with laws prohibiting workplace violence.
Article 93: Workers are entitled to paid leave for attending labor inspectorate meetings.
Article 94: Employers must provide a policy for ensuring equal pay for equal work.
Article 95: Workers are entitled to a safe work environment free from excessive noise.
Article 96: Employers must ensure compliance with laws prohibiting unfair dismissal.
Article 97: Workers are entitled to paid leave for attending collective bargaining sessions.
Article 98: Employers must provide a policy for managing workplace stress.
Article 99: Workers are entitled to a safe work environment free from chemical hazards.
Article 100: Employers must ensure compliance with laws prohibiting wage discrimination.
Article 101: Workers are entitled to paid leave for attending workplace safety audits.
Article 102: Employers must provide a policy for ensuring workplace inclusivity.
Article 103: Workers are entitled to a safe work environment free from physical hazards.
Article 104: Employers must ensure compliance with laws prohibiting harassment based on ethnicity.
Article 105: Workers are entitled to paid leave for attending diversity training.
Article 106: Employers must provide a policy for managing workplace conflicts.
Article 107: Workers are entitled to a safe work environment free from biological hazards.
Article 108: Employers must ensure compliance with laws prohibiting discrimination based on religion.
Article 109: Workers are entitled to paid leave for attending health and safety committee meetings.
Article 110: Employers must provide a policy for ensuring workplace accessibility.
Article 111: Workers are entitled to a safe work environment free from ergonomic hazards.
Article 112: Employers must ensure compliance with laws prohibiting discrimination based on union membership.
Article 113: Workers are entitled to paid leave for attending workplace wellness programs.
Article 114: Employers must provide a policy for managing workplace bullying.
Article 115: Workers are entitled to a safe work environment free from psychological hazards.
Article 116: Employers must ensure compliance with laws prohibiting discrimination based on disability.
Article 117: Workers are entitled to paid leave for attending occupational health assessments.
Article 118: Employers must provide a policy for ensuring workplace mental health support.
Article 119: Workers are entitled to a safe work environment free from electrical hazards.
Article 120: Employers must ensure compliance with laws prohibiting discrimination based on age.
Article 121: Workers are entitled to paid leave for attending workplace safety training.
Article 122: Employers must provide a policy for ensuring workplace gender equality.
Article 123: Workers are entitled to a safe work environment free from thermal hazards.
Article 124: Employers must ensure compliance with laws prohibiting discrimination based on marital status.
Article 125: Workers are entitled to paid leave for attending workplace diversity workshops.
Article 126: Employers must provide a policy for ensuring workplace cultural sensitivity.
Article 127: Workers are entitled to a safe work environment free from radiation hazards.
Article 128: Employers must ensure compliance with laws prohibiting discrimination based on political beliefs.
Article 129: Workers are entitled to paid leave for attending workplace conflict resolution training.
Article 130: Employers must provide a policy for ensuring workplace ethical conduct.
Article 131: Workers are entitled to a safe work environment free from mechanical hazards.
Article 132: Employers must ensure compliance with laws prohibiting discrimination based on sexual orientation.
Article 133: Workers are entitled to paid leave for attending workplace leadership training.
Article 134: Employers must provide a policy for ensuring workplace transparency.
Article 135: Workers are entitled to a safe work environment free from environmental hazards.
Article 136: Employers must ensure compliance with laws prohibiting discrimination based on nationality.
Article 137: Workers are entitled to paid leave for attending workplace team-building activities.
Article 138: Employers must provide a policy for ensuring workplace accountability.
Article 139: Workers are entitled to a safe work environment free from structural hazards.
Article 140: Employers must ensure compliance with laws prohibiting discrimination based on social status.
Article 141: Workers are entitled to paid leave for attending workplace innovation workshops.
Article 142: Employers must provide a policy for ensuring workplace sustainability.
Article 143: Workers are entitled to a safe work environment free from fire hazards.
Article 144: Employers must ensure compliance with laws prohibiting discrimination based on economic status.
Article 145: Workers are entitled to paid leave for attending workplace ethics training.
Article 146: Employers must provide a policy for ensuring workplace fairness.
Article 147: Workers are entitled to a safe work environment free from slip and fall hazards.
Article 148: Employers must ensure compliance with laws prohibiting discrimination based on educational background.
Article 149: Workers are entitled to paid leave for attending workplace compliance training.
Article 150: Employers must provide a policy for ensuring workplace respect.
Article 151: Workers are entitled to a safe work environment free from trip hazards.
Article 152: Employers must ensure compliance with laws prohibiting discrimination based on health status.
Article 153: Workers are entitled to paid leave for attending workplace safety drills.
Article 154: Employers must provide a policy for ensuring workplace collaboration.
Article 155: Workers are entitled to a safe work environment free from falling object hazards.
Article 156: Employers must ensure compliance with laws prohibiting discrimination based on family status.
Article 159: Employers must ensure that all machinery and equipment used in the workplace are maintained in good working condition to prevent occupational accidents and ensure the safety of workers.
Article 160: Workers have the right to refuse to operate any equipment deemed unsafe or defective, provided they inform their supervisor immediately of the situation.
Article 161: Employers are required to conduct regular safety inspections of the workplace and maintain a log of all incidents and corrective actions taken.
Article 162: Any modification to machinery or work processes must be preceded by a risk assessment to evaluate potential hazards to employees.
Article 163: Protective equipment, such as helmets, gloves, and safety shoes, must be provided free of charge to workers exposed to specific risks.
